data.title: Friday Roundtable: Judicial reform, women in sports and the science of friend selection
data.meta_description: This week's roundtable guests bring big ideas to explore: judicial sentencing reform, women in sports, and why people gravitate to others similar to themselves.
data.text:
Listen to a wide-ranging roundtable discussion explores: judicial sentencing reform, women in sports, and why people gravitate to others similar to themselves.

Joining MPR News with Kerri Miller this week: John Tunheim, Chief U.S. District Judge, District of Minnesota; Javier Morillo, President of SEIU Local 26; Mary Jo Kane, Professor at the School of Kinesiology, and the Director of the Tucker Center for Research on Girls & Women in Sport at University of Minnesota.
